pullRequest.body:
This
* weakens the assumptions in [X_pow_sub_C_eq_prod](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/FieldTheory/KummerExtension.html#X_pow_sub_C_eq_prod) on the coefficient ring from "field" to "integral domain", and
* adds results on representing the order `n` of a primitive root of unity `μ` in `R` as a product involving terms like `μ^k - 1`. (In a new file `RingTheory.RootsOfUnity.Lemmas` because of fairly heavy imports.)

This will  be useful for results on Jacobi sums (to be added eventually).

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

nodes.body:
Thanks!

bors merge
Canceled.
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9268826410/job/25498330135)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9268826410/job/25498329879)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9268826410/job/25498330518)
Is it worth substituting n := n - 1?
Looks like it.
I think we usually call such files `lemmas`, or something like that (of course it would be better to find a more precise name, but I understand it is not always possible).
Changed the file name to "Lemmas.lean".
Can you use `∣` explicitly here?

Only at the cost of a certain clumsiness: the point is that the quotient is in `R[μ]`; to express this using `dvd`, we'd have to write something like `(μ - 1 : ALgebra.adjoin R {μ}) ∣μ ^ k - 1` (and use `z.val` to extract the relevant property of the quotient later when the statement is used).

I think this additonal level of complexity outweighs the small simplification in notation (by some margin).

(I guess we could introduce a notion of divisibility in a subring and perhaps also notation for that, but again this looks like overkill to me.)

I was also thinking of inlining this in the proof of `order_eq_mul_self_sub_one_pow`, as it is a fairly specialized statement (with a fairly short proof) whose usefulness outside `order_eq_mul_self_sub_one_pow` is perhaps questionable.
I have now inlined `Algebra.adjoin.sub_one_dvd_pow_sub_one`.

I am not sure using `n+1` is a good idea here. I can be better in principle, but looking at `Mathlib.RingTheory.RootsOfUnity.Basic` I see a bunch of `0<n` and `n : ℕ+`: this is already not great, but I am afraid that adding yet another way of saying the same thing is not great. Of course the real solution is to choose once and for all what to do...

The use of `n+1` to denote a positive natural is, I think, fairly common in Mathlib (and certainly better than using `PNat` in my opinion). The question is probably which version is easier to use. I have no strong opinion here (but hope that merging this will not be delayed because of a lack of consesus among the reviewers on this point :smile:).
I am not advocating to a particular solution, just the fact that we should choose one if possible.
PS: I note that you use `k+1` in `not_exists_int_prime_dvd_sub_of_prime_pow_ne_two` in [#12765](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/12765) ...

I have plans to eventually refactor roots of unity to avoid `PNat`, but this will have to wait until teaching is over.
(This would avoid contortions as in
```lean
  replace hn : (↑u : K) ^ ((⟨n, hnpos⟩ : ℕ+) : ℕ) = 1 := by
```
)
I think it is a good thing, we can maybe discuss it on zulip (for example, do we want to do the same in `IsCyclotomicExtension`? I think so).
Again we can use `∣` (and `dvd` in the name).
See above. Using "dvd" in the name may still make sense, even though the statement does not mention `Dvd.dvd` explicitly.
I've changed the name now (but not the statement).

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(RingTheory/RootsOfUnity): product representation of the order of a primitive root of unity
